intro: Phacellaria ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty phacellaria, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in racemes, and it produces distinctive, elongated pods that contain seeds. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
